page.title: 20A General View of the Area.
page.content: The area of this particular section of the project is marked by Newburgh in the north-west, Dalton in the south-west, and the western adge of Appley Bridge in the east. The northern boundary crosses Parbold Hill, and the southern boundary crosses Ashurst's Beacon. These two hills are separated by the Douglas Valley and delineate the main characteristics of the area. The bulk of the population inhabit Parbold which, though not in the centre of the area of our attention, is very much the focal point of the district. It is a rural farming area with a variety of landscapes within its boundaries. The views of North Wales, Merseyside, the Fylde Coast,& the Lake District from Parbold and Ashurst Hills are spectacular.
